page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: (WOODLAND) About 5% of the agricultural land is woodland,rich in plant life,including trees,shrubs and herbaceous plants.Of the former 35% are sycamore,25% are elms,17% beech,8% oak,and the rest are various.Shrubs are chiefly snowberry or scrub hawthorn;herbaceous are chiefly grass, sheeps parsley,wood violet and wood anemone.Wildlife includes rabbits, hares,stoats,weasels,rats,mice and partridges. (FIELD)Pasture,meadow and arable fields and 5 public footpaths are in the area.Red and white clover abound but thistles and nettles are on the increase.Meadow grass types are tall oat,rye,bent and poa;weeds include persecaria,knotweed, buttercup and dandelion. (PONDS&STREAMS)Many with coarse fish in Most half full of reeds and rushes.
